@ Tanker38

Yes, to include subtitles you need to re-encode the movie with the subtitles.  This generally means a slight loss in quality.  I use Handbrake, a free video program.  This program encodes the video as MP4, used for iDevices.  But it does a good job at keeping quality, so it is my program of choice.  Another program is called AnyVideoConverter, also free, but looses quality throughout the process.

To encode subtitles with Handbrake, make sure your avi file is named exactly the same as the .srt (subtitle file).  Click on source -> Video File.

Then you can change some settings on the tabs in the lower part of the window.  To add subtitles, click on Subtitles tab, then "Add"
